intro: Brownea negrensis, commonly known as the Brazilian pink bell, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a leathery texture. The flowers are usually borne in clusters and are pollinated by birds, particularly hummingbirds.
